contextId.information: Jesus is exaggerating about how a person should respond to their sin to emphasize how serious he is. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: pluck it out ... cut it off

contextId.information: Jesus went to many or most of the cities but not necessarily every one of them. AT: "many of the cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Jesus uses a hyperbole to emphasize that nothing in the world is as valuable as having true life with God. AT: "if he gains everything in the world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: if he gains the whole world

contextId.information: Jesus uses a hyperbole here to emphasize how serious he is. Jesus means a person must do anything necessary to remove from their lives what causes them to sin. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: If your hand or your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off and throw it away from you

contextId.information: Jesus uses a hyperbole here to emphasize how serious he is. Jesus means a person must do anything necessary to remove from their lives what causes them to sin. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
contextId.quote: If your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it away from you
